title: Real Estate Strategist & Transaction Manager
content:
Who we are
About Stripe
Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.
About the team
The Stripe Workplace team creates and operates inspiring, comfortable, and innovative spaces that bring Stripe’s culture and values to life and provide a foundation for achieving our mission. In this role, you will be part of the small (but mighty!) team that determines and executes on our real estate strategy worldwide. We expect you to be ambitious, collaborative, adaptable, and have a positive attitude. This role reports to the Head of Real Estate Strategy, based in Chicago.
What you’ll do
We're looking for an organized, flexible, and detail-oriented person who's enthusiastic for both the practical and creative elements of strategic workplace planning. Stripe is growing rapidly, and our Space Planner will play a critical role in managing and maximizing efficient workspace utilization across our global facilities. In this role, you'll have the unique opportunity to scale and shape Stripe's workspace environment while working collaboratively with stakeholders from across the company.
Responsibilities

Monitor the overall balance of regional real estate portfolio, predict and identify where and when we will have an imbalance of space, and proactively drive solutions that balance local needs with what is best for Stripe
Spearhead efforts to understand headcount growth by business unit by location, creating analytical frameworks and reports to facilitate real estate recommendations
Gather & evaluate real estate market & portfolio scenarios, staying up to date on market changes and researching market, companies, landlords, & potential subtenants 
Prepare, recommend and implement geo-specific real estate strategies from business case to site selection through lease execution. Develop needs assessments and market analyses, propose deal structure, and drive negotiation of leases, serviced office agreements, and sublease agreements
Liaise with Mobility, Tax, Regulatory, Employment Legal, Finance, Accounting and other cross-functional teams on the impacts real estate on business operations
Create written analyses, documents and presentations including but not limited to: project initiation documentation, market reports, RFPs, proposal comparison spreadsheets, letters of intent 
Perform detailed document review of all lease documents in partnership with internal and external Legal

Who you are
We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.
Minimum requirements

8+ years experience on a Workplace or Real Estate team with experience working on complex deal negotiations and lease transactions, preferably at a high-growth company
Superior negotiation and leasing skills, with understanding of legal complexities (JD not required)
Strong analytical skills, the demonstrated ability to ask the right questions and to use sound business judgment
Strategic thinker who excels at finding creative solutions to short and long term questions, and writing clear and compelling business cases
The ability to maintain high performance while managing multiple projects under tight timelines, and a “roll up your sleeves” mindset to get any job done
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, able to progress projects asynchronously across timezones through written channels. 
Excellent project management skills - ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage deadlines with autonomy
Able to effectively coordinate a wide variety of stakeholders and build relationships with a diverse range of people and job functions/levels. 
The ability and willingness to travel for work as needed, including to international destinations, and to work across time zones as is necessary.

questions.description: Stripe is currently operating in a hybrid work environment. In-office expectations for office-assigned Stripes vary by team. A remote location, in most cases, is defined as living 50 miles or more from an office location. While you would be welcome to join the office for team or business meetings when necessary, the expectation would be that you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office location. Stripe offices are located in Amsterdam, Bangkok, Bengaluru, Berlin, Chicago, Dubai, Dublin, Jakarta, London, Madrid, Mexico City, New York City, Paris, São Paulo, Singapore, South San Francisco, Seattle, Tokyo, and Toronto. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location in which you live or have intentions to live.
questions.label: If this role offers the option to work from a remote location, do you plan to work remotely?

values.label: Yes, I intend to work remotely.
No, I intend to work from an office location.
